intro: Cusparia pentagyna, commonly known as the five-angled grass. It is a flowering plant native to South Africa, belonging to the family Poaceae, which includes grasses. The plant is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and small, clustered inflorescences. Its flowers are typically greenish or brownish, with two stamens and a single pistil. Cusparia pentagyna is often found in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments.
